intro: Englerina ochroleuca, commonly known as the yellow-leafed englerina, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Asia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptical leaves that are typically yellow-green in color. Its small, white flowers are clustered in umbels and bloom during the rainy season. Englerina ochroleuca is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky slopes.
